Ctrl + Alt for to escapte the focus of VM.

1. Starts the server form installation disk:
    Press Esc from the very beginning. You need to do it quick, before the boot memu starts.
    From the new boot menu, select "CD-ROM device"
    
2. Select "Troubleshooting" from the menu item, then select "rescue a Red Hat Enterpsise linux system"

3. Linux is going to find an installed linux system (rescue system) and mount it under /mnt/sysimage. Press 1 to accept the "Continue" option. Enter twice to access the rescue shell.

4. Now your system is accessible through /mnt/sysimage. 
Type "chroot /mnt/sysimage" to run command with the new root directory and get in to the root shell.
Now you can access all the tools that you need to repair the system.

5. Type Exit to exit the root shell. Type reboot to restart the machine in a normal mode.
